attacks.name: Strike and Run
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. You may switch Dunsparce with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sudden Flash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Lotad.

attacks.name: Double Bubble
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. If either of the coins is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Flareon.

attacks.name: Deadly Poison
attacks.text: You may discard a Grass Energy card attached to Seviper. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Extra Poison
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

ability.name: Rain Dish
ability.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Ludicolo.

attacks.name: Hydro Punch
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Ludicolo but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Sand Swirl
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Poison Resistance
ability.text: Zangoose can't be Poisoned.

attacks.name: Target Slash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Seviper, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Super Slash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

ability.name: Poison Payback
ability.text: If Cacnea is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Cacnea is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

ability.name: Baby Evolution
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Electabuzz from your hand onto Elekid (this counts as evolving Elekid) and remove all damage counters from Elekid.

attacks.name: Gather Energy
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Pelipper but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Soothing Wave
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Lazy Punch
attacks.text: Slakoth can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Root Fossil
text: Play Root Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Root Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Root Fossil has no attacks of its own can't retreat and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Root Fossil is Knocked Out it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack you may discard Root Fossil from play."
At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Root Fossil.

attacks.name: Fast Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sky Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Lairon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Suprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Rare Candy
text: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 1 or Stage 2 card that evolves from that Pokémon in your hand, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.)

ability.name: Energy Variation
ability.text: Kecleon's type is the same as every type of basic Energy card attached to Kecleon.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Wally's Training
text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from your Active Pokémon (choose 1 if there are 2) and put it on your Active Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.
You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

ability.name: Rain Dish
ability.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Lotad.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. You switch Baltoy with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: Steel Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards that evolve from Eevee, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Fire Veil
ability.text: If Growlithe is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Growlithe is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psychic Boom
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Double Full Heal
text: Remove all Special Conditions from each of your Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Lanette's Net Search
text: Search your deck for up to 3 different types of Basic Pokémon cards (excluding Baby Pokémon), show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

cards.name: Multi Energy
text: Attach Multi Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Multi Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play.) Multi Energy provides Colorless Energy when attached to a Pokémon that already has Special Energy cards attached to it."

ability.name: Super Suction Cups
ability.text: As long as Cradily is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Lure Poison
attacks.text: Before using this effect, you may switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, if any. The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Cradily (remove 1 if there is only 1).

ability.name: Lunar Eclipse
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Solrock is in play, you may use this power. Until the end of your turn, Lunatone's type is Darkness. This power can't be used if Lunatone is affected by a Special Condition."

attacks.name: Cosmic Draw
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokémon in play, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Supernatural
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. You may use the effect of a Supporter card you find there as the effect of this attack. (The Supporter card remains in your opponent's hand.)

attacks.name: Dark Bind
attacks.text: You may discard a Darkness Energy card attached to Sableye. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Fire Veil
ability.text: If Arcanine is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Arcanine is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Burn Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Fire Energy cards attached to Arcanine.

ability.name: Chaos Flash
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Golduck is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon (choose 1 if there are 2) is now Confused. This power can't be used if Golduck is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Special Blow
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Special Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Pull Down
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokémon in play, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from each of them and put those cards back into his or her hand.

attacks.name: Hydrocannon
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omastar but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Drizzle
attacks.text: If you have Water Energy cards in your hand, attach as many Water Energy cards as you like to any of your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Max Bubbles
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to all of your Active Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Ultra Energy Source
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of basic Energy attached to all of the Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Electabuzz.

attacks.name: Thunder Spear
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Double Wing Attack
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

ability.name: Glowing Screen
ability.text: As long as Volbeat is in play, any damage done to Illumise by attacks from Fire Pokémon and Dark Pokémon is reduced by 30. You can't reduce more than 30 damage even if there is more than 1 Volbeat in play.

attacks.name: Chaotic Noise
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Link Blast
attacks.text: If Kirlia and the Defending Pokémon have a different amount of Energy attached to them, this attack's base damage is 30 instead of 60.

attacks.name: Influence
attacks.text: Search your deck for Omanyte, Kabuto, Aerodactyl, Lileep, or Anorith and put up to 2 of them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Time Spiral
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokémon in play, choose 1 of them and flip a coin. If heads, take the highest Stage Evolution card on that Pokémon and have your opponent shuffle it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Sniff Out
attacks.text: Put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

ability.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Lombre.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.text: You may discard a Fire Energy card attached to Quilava. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, base damage of Vigoroth's slash attack is 90 instead of 40.

ability.name: Uplifting Glow
ability.text: As long as Illumise is in play, Volbeat's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Toxic Vibration
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

ability.name: Baby Evolution
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Wobbuffet from your hand onto Wynaut (this counts as evolving Wynaut), and remove all damage counters from Wynaut.

attacks.name: Alluring Smile
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card or Evolution card for each Energy attached to Wynaut, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Suprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Team Assembly
attacks.text: Search your deck for Omanyte, Kabuto, or any Basic Pokémon and put as many of them as you like onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Confusion Wave
attacks.text: Both Psyduck and the Defending Pokémon are now Confused.

attacks.name: Super Speed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Spearow during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Sand Pit
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Super Hypno Wave
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Claw Fossil
text: Play Claw Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Claw Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Claw Fossil has no attacks of its own can't retreat and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Claw Fossil is Knocked Out it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack you may discard Claw Fossil from play."
If Claw Fossil is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Claw Fossil is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.name: Mysterious Fossil
text: Play Mysterious Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Mysterious Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Mysterious Fossil has no attacks of its own can't retreat and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Mysterious Fossil is Knocked Out it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack you may discard Mysterious Fossil from play."

cards.name: Kabutops ex
text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hyrdocutter
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Energy attached to Kabutops ex. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. You can't flip more than 3 coins in this way.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Kabutops ex (remove 1 if there is only 1).

cards.name: Raichu ex
text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Judgement
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Random Curse
attacks.text: Put a total of 5 damage counters on all Defending Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Jolteon. If you do, this attack's base damage is 70 instead of 40.

attacks.name: Scam
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. You may have your opponent shuffle a Supporter card you find there into his or her deck. If you do, your opponent draws a card.

attacks.name: Metal Hook
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Fan Away
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, return 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to your opponent's hand. This power can't be used if Shiftry is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Light Touch Throw
attacks.text: Does 80 damage minus 10 damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Solar Eclipse
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Lunatone is in play, you may use this power. Until the end of your turn, Solrock's type is Fire. This power can't be used if Solrock is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Cosmic Draw
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokémon in play, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

ability.name: Baby Evolution
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu.

attacks.name: Energy Retrieval
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon for each Energy card attached in this way.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Steelix.

attacks.name: Spinning Tail
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Safeguard
ability.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Wobbuffet by your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.text: Wobbuffet does 10 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

ability.name: Intimidating Fang
ability.text: As long as Arbok is your Active Pokémon, any damage to your Pokémon done by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

ability.name: Baby Evolution
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Marill from your hand onto Azurill (this counts as evolving Azurill), and remove all damage counters from Azurill.

attacks.name: Jump Catch
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

ability.name: Exoskeleton
ability.text: Any damage done to Kabuto by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Team Assembly
attacks.text: Search your deck for Omanyte, Kabuto, or any Basic Pokémon and put as many of them as you like onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bind

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Onix.

attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

cards.name: Wailord ex
text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
